collections.name: Sahih al-Bukhari
collections.author: Imam Muhammad ibn Ismail al-Bukhari
collections.description: Collected by Imam Muhammad ibn Ismail al-Bukhari. Considered the most authentic hadith collection after the Quran.

collections.name: Sahih Muslim
collections.author: Imam Muslim ibn al-Hajjaj
collections.description: Compiled by Imam Muslim. Second most authentic hadith collection, known for its strict criteria.

collections.name: Sunan Abu Dawud
collections.author: Imam Abu Dawud al-Sijistani
collections.description: Focuses on legal hadiths related to jurisprudence and Islamic law.

collections.name: Jami' at-Tirmidhi
collections.author: Imam at-Tirmidhi
collections.description: Known for commenting on the grade and authentication of each hadith.

collections.name: Sunan an-Nasa'i
collections.author: Imam an-Nasa'i
collections.description: One of the six major hadith collections, focusing on legal matters.

collections.name: Sunan Ibn Majah
collections.author: Imam Ibn Majah
collections.description: Sixth of the major hadith collections, contains unique hadiths not found in others.
